item.title: Introduction to Android SQLite Database
item.description: Android provide various options for data persistence like Preferences, File and Database etc. This post we will introduce you to one of the option i.e. Android SQLite Database. Let us take an example of Student database. i.e. student_database (DATABASE_NAME). We will create table tb_student (DATABASE_TABLE), with 3 columns i.e. _id (KEY_ROWID), name (KEY_NAME) and grade (KEY_GRADE). Columns _id is primary key and autoincrement, while name and garde are text .
